issues.description: The reference implementation declares checkOrderReady with a boolean parameter, but the problem specification and UML define checkOrderReady() as a no-argument method. This mismatch in method signature would confuse students implementing the required API.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the reference implementation of checkOrderReady to a no-argument signature: `public void checkOrderReady()`, removing the boolean parameter, so it matches the specification. Adjust internal calls from `checkOrderReady(true)` to `checkOrderReady()`.
